Description.val:
The VIRGINIA Class BLI 0942 provides a wide range of materials required to operate, test, support and maintain the viability of VIRGINIA SSN774 Class Submarines.  There is a decrease in the request from FY20 to FY21 driven primarily by the final investment in the Naval Foundry and Propeller Center (NFPC) High speed Machine funding profile in FY20 offset by an increase in the number of VIRGINIA Payload Tubes (VPT) Platforms in FY21.  VIRGINIA Class Submarines must maintain a required Platform to Submarine ratio of 0.6 through the FYDP.  The increased quantity of 2 to 3 in FY21 is required to maintain this ratio.  Additional details are provided below for each effort.

The "Major Shore Spares" component includes rotatable pool and insurance spares.  Propulsor rotatable pool assets support planned maintenance during scheduled availabilities by decreasing equipment turn-around time/availability duration. Rotatable pool program equipment includes the high pressure air compressor, various pump/motor assemblies, radar mast, ventilation fans and thin line towed array components and other components.  There is a significant increase in the profile in FY18, FY19 and FY20 in support of additional high speed machining capabilities at the NFPC in Philadelphia.  This is the VIRGINIA Program Office portion of the propulsor foundry equipment as agreed to by PEO SUB, VIRGINIA Program Office, and COLUMBIA Program Office.

The Test and Evaluation (T&E) component includes upgrading the afloat acoustic system required to conduct TECHEVAL/OPEVAL satisfactorily, efficiently and with minimal risk of equipment failure. Conduct hardware and software development, procurement, maintenance, and operations as required to achieve and maintain the submarine acoustic signatures trials program. The resultant capabilities support the Submarine Acoustic Trials Enterprise, which includes the VIRGINIA Class submarine test and evaluation program.  

VPT and Intermediate and Depot (I&D) Support Equipment funding includes Vertical Launch System (VLS) Peculiar Support Equipment (PSE) for All-Up Round Simulators (AURS)/All-Up Round (AUR) Ballast Cans necessary to conduct TECHEVAL/OPEVAL and provide ballast for ship operation.  

Non-Tactical Data Processing System (NTDPS) funding includes shipboard wireless LAN that provides a ship wide (forward of the reactor compartment) intranet (Non-classified Internet Protocol (IP) Router Network (Unclassified Enclave) (NIPRNET)) that significantly enhances the quality of the work by facilitating electronic correspondence, personnel data management, collaborative services, interactive whiteboard, multi-user chat and access to these sites: Fleet Training Management & Planning System/Navy Training Management & Planning System (FTMPS/NTMPS), Composite Health Care System (CHCS), prescriptions, MYPAY-Defense Finance and Accounting Service (DFAS), Navy Personnel Command (NPC), Bureau of Naval Personnel (BUPERS), email, Fleet Technical Support Center, Atlantic (FTSCLANT), Submarine Maintenance Engineering, Planning and Procurement (SUBMEPP) and Navy Knowledge Online (NKO).

The Hotel Services Working Group (HSWG) cost component provides funding for procurement and installation of materials necessary to modernize VIRGINIA Class Submarine Blocks I & II (774-783) infrastructure (i.e. power, cabling, cooling and arrangements of the ship for the entire Government Furnished Equipment (GFE)/Contractor furnished Equipment (CFE) Non-Propulsion Electronic System (NPES) configuration. This combination of Hull, Mechanical and Electrical (HM&E) alterations to VIRGINIA Class submarines is collectively referred to as the "Hotel Services" modification. The last Hotel Services modernization kit procurement for SSN774 took place in FY18 and was installed during FY19 Depot Modernization Period(DMP). Block III and follow ships do not require this significant HM&E infrastructure upgrade as the baseline design for those ships accounts for the necessary power, cabling, cooling, etc. required to host upgrades to major combat systems. 

Maintenance Planning System funds will be used to help ship programs identify, plan and execute maintenance activities as well as improve efficiently at all levels (performed by ship's force as well as organizational/depot level) by creating a set of tools to provide a robust, distributed and comprehensive training and maintenance solution delivering dynamic content. This set of tools and the associated ship-to-shore data environment will reduce Operations & Maintenance, Navy (OM&N) funding over time. This will be fielded as part of the Non-Tactical Data Processing System (NTDPS) to VIRGINIA Class submarines.

Additionally, the continuous ship upgrades necessary to maintain class viability of the earlier ships are included in this funding line. This is particularly important for Commercial Off-the-Shelf (COTS) Technology Refreshment and Technology Upgrades for NPES. The class level of modernization and capability rests on available resources.

[P40A / Auxiliary Equipment]: Auxiliary equipment component includes funding for ladders and ladder storage containers for Sail Racetracks, Logistics Escape Trunk/Logistics Plug Trunk (LET/LPT) and other equipment such as I&D material, support material for VPT, and storage containers for Center Cell Access Port(CCAP)/All Up Round Volumetric Shape(AURS)/All Up Round Ballast Grade B(AURBb).

[P40A / Non-Tactical Data Processing System]: Provide software and hardware updates, software licenses and technical and logistics support to the Non-Tactical Data Processing System (NTDPS).

Justification.val: The decrease in funding from FY20 to FY21 was driven primarily by a decrease of major shore spares due to the final investment in the NFPC High Speed Machine funding profile in FY20 ($7.2M) offset by an increase in the number of VPTs Platforms under I&D equipment in FY21 of $1.7M.

Name.val: 3) H1RC8 - VPT and I&D Support Equipment

Name.@footnote: The VACL Submarines are being delivered at a rate of two per year, and must maintain a required platform to submarine ratio of 0.6 thru the FYDP.  The increased quantity of 2 to 3 in FY21 is required to maintain this ratio.

Name.val: 4) H1RC13 TECH INSERTION TECH REFRESH & UPGRADES
4.1) Shipboard Mobile Computing NTDPS (ULAN + SW Enclave + PDOCS + Upgrades)

Name.@footnote: Rotatable Pool increases slightly beyond inflation due to the material volatility of components.  Further details can be provided at the appropriate classification level.

The significant decrease in the profile from FY20 to FY21 is due to the final investment in the High Speed Machining capabilities at the Naval Foundry and Propeller Center (NFPC) in Philadelphia occurs in FY20.

Name.val: Rolls Royce Marine North America - Spare Rotor
Naval Foundary & Propeller Center - High Speed Machine

Description.val:
Procure equipment and materials necessary to support the VIRGINIA Class submarine program.  Materials are as large as rotors and as small as anodes and fasteners.  VIRGINIA Class rotatable pool rotors are removed, refurbished, and placed into a pool. There is no set installation schedule as rotors, once available, are installed on subsequent availabilities. 

Procure production tooling and fixtures and Leica trackers/scanners in support of additional high speed machining capabilities at the Naval Foundry and Propeller Center (NFPC) in Philadelphia.

Name.@footnote: VA Platform Modernization TI-02 Baseline Upgrade

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: TI-02 Baseline Upgrade

Description.val:
Provide procurement of materials necessary to modernize VIRGINIA Class Submarine Blocks I & II (774-783) infrastructure (i.e. power, cabling, cooling, and arrangements of the ship for the entire Government Furnished Equipment (GFE)/ Contractor Furnished Equipment (CFE) NPES configuration).  This combination of Hull, Mechanical and Electrical (HM&E) alterations to VIRGINIA Class submarines is collectively referred to as the "Hotel Services" modification.  This Hotel Service modification is necessary to accommodate modernization to major combat system alterations (i.e. A-RCI, AN/BYG-1, and ISIS) and are completed concurrently with those major combat system alterations.  TI-02 baseline systems Hotel Services modernizations are completed during Post Shakedown Availability (PSA) for SSN777 and SSN779-783 and during EDSRA or TYCOM Operational Availability (TOA) for SSN774-SSN776 and SSN778.  Block III and follow ships do not require this significant HM&E infrastructure upgrade as the baseline design for those ships accounts for the necessary power, cabling, cooling, etc. required to host upgrades to major combat systems.

Final hotel services modernization kit was procured in FY18 and installed in PB19. This is the final procurement and installation for HSWG, after which all Block I and II hulls will have received the upgrade.
